column4: [Ubuntu 11.10 GNOME Shell 3.2.1] I am recording an internet radio stream. Why can I not hear it at the same time? Pressing Windows-key > gnome-control-center > Audio > Applications > ALSA plugin [firefox] is not muted. (Last night it worked.)
Invaluable is the proper word here: You never know if it is of value to you. The webpage you recommended is for GNOME 2 and not for GNOME 3.
The steps 1 through 5 are all positively fulfilled.
mmm...no...most of that should work at the driver level...if that's your problem that is.
I do not have a driver problem. As I said, it worked last night.
Yeah, I know, there's been a bug that I haven't been able to/tried much to pin down where the configuration seems to corrupt...
Easiest way I find to deal with it is use a utility like alsamixer.

However you also failed to give me any particulars about the streamer you are using and what parameters/options you are using, so I could imagine that the sound itself is fine and that you accidentally clicked an option.
For instance with vlc there is an option you must select to make loopback streamed audio when saving to disk.
I am using VLC media player as streamer.
For Ubuntu 11.10 the current VLC media player version is 1.1.12.
I'm presuming you've tried the obvious then, namely that it doesn't work with other radio stations, that vlc can in fact play audio
I would say that if you can get vlc to play audio, the problem is not ubuntu's or your sound drivers; I would take it up with vlc (try #vlc)
I agree: My problem is not with Ubuntu nor with my sound driver. A very good advice: I will try #vlc. --  Thank you very much for your help.
I don't know how up-to-date this documentation is, but if it helps any: http://wiki.videolan.org/Documentation:Streaming_HowTo_New#Transcoding_using_the_GUI
Hopefully more concise than me rambling on to you. :)
